meanings.definition: to make a mistake in atoning for a wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: She misatoned by apologizing to the wrong person.
meanings.sent2: He misatoned for his lateness by bringing flowers.
meanings.sent3: The cat misatoned by bringing a mouse instead of a bird as a gift.
meanings.sent4: The student misatoned for his plagiarism by admitting his fault.
meanings.sent5: The chef misatoned for the burnt dish by preparing a delicious dessert instead.

meanings.definition: having failed to properly make amends for a sin or offense.
meanings.sent1: The misatoned apology only made matters worse.
meanings.sent2: She felt misatoned for not attending the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The misatoned cake was a result of using salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: His misatoned promise left her feeling disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The misatoned repair job caused more damage than before.
